rows.title: Breathe to three

transcript.eng:
Close your eyes. 

Use the magic power of three to stay connected and relax.

Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.

Do you feel any different? Deep breathing helps our whole body and mind to calm down. 

You are a star!

text_1.eng: Let’s take a moment for YOU. Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great! So good to hear you are in a positive space.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Things are not always easy. But that is how we can grow and learn every day!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Life can be hard. Whatever you are feeling, you can be proud of yourself for being here!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about spending one-on-one time with our teens. 

Being a parent can be so hard. Sometimes it feels like our teens never listen to us.

But science shows that spending just a few minutes each day of focused one-on-one time with your teen helps build trust and love.

media_title.eng: Why is spending one-on-one time with your teens important? Click play to learn

media_transcript.eng:
Hello.

Our topic today is one-on-one time with our children.

It is important to spend time with our children so that they can get to understand us, and for us to get an opportunity to understand them.

Remember, a family with good understanding lives in harmony.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about spending one-on-one time with our teens. 

Being a parent can be so hard. Sometimes it feels like our teens never listen to us.

But science shows that spending just a few minutes each day of focused one-on-one time with your teen helps build trust and love.
rows.media_title: Why is spending one-on-one time with your teens important? Click play to learn
rows.media_transcript:
Hello.

Our topic today is one-on-one time with our children.

It is important to spend time with our children so that they can get to understand us, and for us to get an opportunity to understand them.

Remember, a family with good understanding lives in harmony.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Let's discuss, what is one-on-one time?

One-on-one time is when you focus on your teens, without distractions like TVs or phones. Let your teens take lead in choosing what you do or talk about.

It is great if you can spend fifteen minutes a day together, but even five minutes a day is really good.

media_title.eng: Hear how one-on-one time helped @data.characters.media_female_1.name and her teen

media_transcript.eng:
When I first heard I had to spend One-on-One Time with my teen, it was hard for me. I did not know when to do it or what to say. I did not want to spoil my teen so that he thinks we have to do everything together.

But I really wanted to build my relationship with my teen and I wanted him to open up about what was troubling him. So we tried the One-on-One Time.

First, it felt weird, but it turned out to be fun! Now we watch his TV programme together and we chat about it. And we can even talk about how my son is changing into adolescence and even about girlfriends and those things!

rows.media_transcript:
When I first heard I had to spend One-on-One Time with my teen, it was hard for me. I did not know when to do it or what to say. I did not want to spoil my teen so that he thinks we have to do everything together.

But I really wanted to build my relationship with my teen and I wanted him to open up about what was troubling him. So we tried the One-on-One Time.

First, it felt weird, but it turned out to be fun! Now we watch his TV programme together and we chat about it. And we can even talk about how my son is changing into adolescence and even about girlfriends and those things!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Let's think of ways to spend time with your teen.

It may take some time to get used to one-on-one time, but the more you do it, the better it gets!

You are an amazing parent for trying this.

quiz_1_question.eng: What could you do to spend one-on-one time with your teen?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
Great idea! 

Feel like you have NO TIME and you are exhausted? Remember to also think of ways that do not take up extra time, like doing a chore together while chatting.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are some skills to help guide you in spending one-on-one time with your teen!

section_1_text.eng:
Try to do it every day. 

Find 5 minutes (or more!) each day when your teen does not have something else they want to do.

section_2_text.eng:
Let your teen choose.

Tell your teen that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. They might think this is weird at first, but they will come to enjoy this time with you!

section_3_text.eng:
Focus on your teen.

Switch off the TV and put phones aside. Look at your teen. Nod or say “I see” to show that you are really paying attention. Accept what they say without judging them.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are some skills to help guide you in spending one-on-one time with your teen!
rows.section_1_text:
Try to do it every day. 

Find 5 minutes (or more!) each day when your teen does not have something else they want to do.
rows.section_2_text:
Let your teen choose.

Tell your teen that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. They might think this is weird at first, but they will come to enjoy this time with you!
rows.section_3_text:
Focus on your teen.

Switch off the TV and put phones aside. Look at your teen. Nod or say “I see” to show that you are really paying attention. Accept what they say without judging them.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Spending one-on-one time with your teen can be hard to plan. Here are some easy ideas that worked for other parents.

text_2.eng:
**Ideas for one-on-one time with your teen:**
- Walk to the shops
- Play a game/sport
- Do a chore together
- Prepare dinner
- Eat breakfast/lunch/dinner
- Have tea after school
- Watch a TV show
- Review homework
- Chat before bedtime


**Remember to use your new skills:**
📅 **DAY**: try to do it every day,
⚽ **PLAY**: let your teen choose how to spend one-on-one time, and 
🎯 **STAY**: be focused on your teen!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Spending one-on-one time with your teen can be hard to plan. Here are some easy ideas that worked for other parents.
rows.text_2:
**Ideas for one-on-one time with your teen:**

- Play a game/sport
- Do a chore together
- Prepare dinner
- Eat breakfast/lunch/dinner
- Have tea after school
- Watch a TV show
- Review homework
- Chat before bedtime


**Remember to use your new skills:**
📅 **DAY**: try to do it every day,
⚽ **PLAY**: let your teen choose how to spend one-on-one time, and 
🎯 **STAY**: be focused on your teen!

text_1_facilitator.eng: This week's home activity is to spend 5-15 minutes of one-on-one time with your teen, every day that you can.

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you spend one-on-one time with your teen this week?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Parents who spend focused one-on-one time with their teens can build trust and love!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: You can do it! Try spending just a few minutes each day with your teen. Remember that you can always think of ways that do not take up extra time, like walking to the shop or preparing dinner together.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. Spending focused time with your teen will become easier as you build a routine. At first, you can try to think of ways that do not take up extra time, like doing a chore together.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That's great! Parents who spend focused one-on-one time with their teens can build trust and love!

rows.quiz_1_question: Can you spend one-on-one time with your teen this week?
rows.text_1_facilitator: This week's home activity is to spend 5-15 minutes of one-on-one time with your teen, every day that you can.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Remember, spending even a few minutes of one-on-one time with your teen each day can strengthen your relationship and build trust. 

Listening closely and sharing small moments helps teens feel loved and supported.

media_title.eng: Here's what @data.characters.media_daughter_1.name has to say about one-on-one time with her mother

media_transcript.eng:
When my mother asked to spend time with me, I thought “Maybe something is wrong, maybe she is sick.” But she said “No, I just want to spend time.” I was sceptical, but I accepted.

She asked me what I like doing. It was strange and I was not comfortable, because she never ever spent time with me on my own.

The more she kept on trying and we spent this time together, it felt really nice. She got to share her own childhood with me, things I never heard before. That helped me to also share what is going on in my life. We even talk about boyfriends and about problems I have. I know I can talk to my mother now.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Remember, spending even a few minutes of one-on-one time with your teen each day can strengthen your relationship and build trust. 

Listening closely and sharing small moments helps teens feel loved and supported.
rows.media_title: Here's what @data.characters.media_daughter_1.name has to say about one-on-one time with her mother
rows.media_transcript:
When my mother asked to spend time with me, I thought “Maybe something is wrong, maybe she is sick.” But she said “No, I just want to spend time.” I was sceptical, but I accepted.

She asked me what I like doing. It was strange and I was not comfortable, because she never ever spent time with me on my own.

The more she kept on trying and we spent this time together, it felt really nice. She got to share her own childhood with me, things I never heard before. That helped me to also share what is going on in my life. We even talk about boyfriends and about problems I have. I know I can talk to my mother now.
